description: The round payoff this round was 90. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 45.
Choosing option 1 leads to an equal split of the round payoff when both players choose it, promoting cooperation.
The game structure incentivizes players to consider the actions of their opponent, as the payoffs vary significantly based on their choices.
The outcomes suggest that mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) is beneficial for both players, as it maximizes the total payoff received.
The potential for higher individual payoffs exists when one player chooses option 2 while the other chooses option 1, indicating a risk-reward dynamic in the decision-making process.
The game encourages strategic thinking and prediction of the opponent's behavior, as the best outcome depends on both players' choices.
